wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir Arthur Francis Smith,  (9 December 1890 – 8 August 1977) was a senior British Army officer who served during the Second World War.

*Lieutenant-General Sir Arthur Smith,  1942–1944 late Coldstream Guards
* 1944 - 1945 Lieutenant General Sir Arthur Smith

Born on 12 February 1891 in Belgravia, Westminster, London, the son of Edward Henry Loyd, Charles Loyd was educated at EtonSmart, p. 195 and the Royal Military College, Sandhurst and was commissioned as a second lieutenant into the Coldstream Guards on 3 September 1910. Another future general, Arthur Smith, was among his fellow graduates.
